title: MOSTLY AI vs Amundsen: Which data governance Tool is Better in 2026?
metaDescription: Compare MOSTLY AI vs Amundsen. See pricing, features, pros & cons to choose the best data governance tool for your needs in 2026.
introduction: Choosing between MOSTLY AI and Amundsen for your data governance needs? Both are popular tools in the AI space, but they have different strengths, pricing models, and use cases. This comprehensive comparison breaks down the key differences to help you make an informed decision.

sections.title: Overview: MOSTLY AI vs Amundsen
paragraphs: MOSTLY AI is MOSTLY AI is a synthetic data generation platform that enables organizations to create highly accurate, privacy-safe synthetic versions of their real-world datasets. Its core capabilities include generating high-fidelity synthetic tabular, time-series, and visual data while mathematically guaranteeing privacy through differential privacy and its proprietary TabularARGN model. It uniquely targets enterprises in regulated industries like finance, insurance, and healthcare, providing an open-source SDK for transparency and control, making it a leader in privacy-preserving data synthesis.. It's known for synthetic-data, data-privacy, differential-privacy.

Amundsen, on the other hand, is Amundsen is an open-source data discovery and metadata engine originally developed by Lyft. It provides a centralized search and catalog interface for data assets (tables, dashboards, streams) across an organization, enabling users to find, understand, and trust data. Its key capabilities include automated metadata ingestion, data lineage visualization, and usage-driven ranking, uniquely focusing on improving data productivity and reducing time spent searching for data.. Users choose it for data-catalog, metadata-management, data-lineage.

sections.title: Pricing Comparison
paragraphs: When it comes to value for money, consider your specific use case and team size.

sections.title: Features & Capabilities
paragraphs: MOSTLY AI excels in: Synthetic Tabular Data Generation with proprietary TabularARGN (Adversarial Regressor Graph Network) model, Differential Privacy guarantees with mathematically proven privacy bounds, Open-source Synthetic Data SDK (SDK) for Python, allowing for local, transparent data generation. This makes it ideal for teams that need synthetic-data.

Amundsen stands out with: Automated metadata ingestion from sources like Apache Atlas, AWS Glue, and databases, Search interface with ranking based on usage patterns (e.g., frequent queries, popularity), Column-level lineage tracking to visualize data flow and dependencies. It's particularly strong for users focused on data-catalog.

sections.title: Use Cases: When to Choose Each Tool
paragraphs: Choose MOSTLY AI if: You need synthetic-data, work with data-privacy, or require enterprise-grade support.
Choose Amundsen if: You prioritize data-catalog, work in metadata-management, or prefer their pricing model.

sections.title: Pros & Cons
paragraphs: MOSTLY AI Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.5/5), Extensive feature set.
MOSTLY AI Cons: Some limitations on free tier.
Amundsen Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.4/5), Comprehensive features.
Amundsen Cons: May have feature limitations.

verdict: Both MOSTLY AI and Amundsen are solid choices for data governance. Your choice depends on your specific requirements: MOSTLY AI is better for synthetic-data, while Amundsen excels at data-catalog. Consider trying both with their free tiers or trials to see which fits your workflow better.
